title: chore: Release railwayapp version 3.9.2
body: Bumps to 3.9.2

title: Fix CLI compilation
body:
Updated rust version in nix shell.

Updated packages and fixed compilation error caused by breaking changes from hyper 1.0.0-rc, since cargo install doesn't respect cargo lock.

Added the SystemConfiguration framework on mac, since the linker was failing because of it in my machine.

title: Fix bad formatting
body: This pull request fixes a formatting issue in the `up.rs` file. The `Build failed` message was not being displayed correctly. This PR updates the message to display the correct error information and adds a fallback message if the error is empty.

title: `railway redeploy`
body:
This command adds a `railway redeploy` command.

Fixes #298

title: Fix release CI and NPM CI
body:
Fixes #494

Also fixes the NPM version not being up to date

title: Fix service command showing services that aren't in current environment
body:
Fixes #507.

This makes sure the service command only displays services that are in the current environment.

title: `railway up --ci` now waits for healthchecks
body:
`railway up --ci` now waits for healthchecks.

Fixes #503.

This also removes the annoying polling method of finding out if the deployment succeeded, switching to a subscription.

title: verbose railway up flag
body: Enables debugging why `railway up` is failing.

title: Fix timeout & and add spinner
body:
This makes the request timeout across the CLI to the GraphQL API 15 seconds.

This also adds a spinner when running `railway volume add`

title: Optimise binary size
body: This makes the binary size smaller in release mode

title: Add volume support to the CLI
body:
This PR adds the ability to update, list, create and delete volumes in a project.

A new command has been added, `railway volume` with various subcommands (create, delete, update, list, attach, detach).

Fixes #499

title: Fix RAILWAY_TOKEN not working with railway up --ci
body:
- **some auth tweaks**
- **some changes**
- **q dir!**

title: Delete accidental config.toml
body: Changes from another branch accidentally slipped into this one :(

title: Rewrite link command
body: Fixes #491 This also changes how the command works to be much simpler. Unfortunately, due to the graphql client we use giving us 3 types for a Project (which are all the same), a `NormalisedProject` struct is needed. Other then that, the code is much more self-explanatory.

title: use --ci flag instead of --cicd
body: Fast follow PR from https://github.com/railwayapp/cli/pull/477 to use `--ci` instead of `--cicd`

title: fix: update version to match with latest release
body:
👋 looks like the version is still pointing to the old release, correcting it to match with the latest release.

relates to https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/pull/168599

title: Remove references to plugins
body:
Fixes #480
This PR:
- Removes the `delete` command
- Fixes the `add` command, allowing it to now deploy template powered databases
- Removes all references of plugins

title: Upgrade graphql-ws-client to v0.8.0
body:
Hello railway people.

I'm the author of `graphql-ws-client`, the library you're using to do GraphQL subscriptions.  I've put a bunch of effort into simplifying and improving its API lately.  I updated your use of it in this repo as part of my testing effort, so figured I might as well share that update and save you some work - so here it is.

title: Add --no-gitignore flag to up command
body:
This pull request adds a new flag, --no-gitignore, to the up command. When this flag is used, the command will not ignore paths specified in the .gitignore file. This allows for more flexibility when deploying to different environments.

Superceeds #481

title: Revert "Remove .gitignore from ignore files in `up`"
body: Reverts railwayapp/cli#481

title: Remove .gitignore from ignore files in `up`
body: This removes the searching of .gitignore in the up command. This previously caused some unknown behaviour.

title: Fix i686-pc-windows-gnu target build
body:
This PR fixes occasional railway cli install errors.

Related help threads:
https://discord.com/channels/713503345364697088/1196823606320185445
https://discord.com/channels/713503345364697088/1194757540693671978

Related issues:
https://github.com/railwayapp/cli/issues/454
https://github.com/railwayapp/cli/issues/428

The i686-pc-windows-gnu target does not compile on windows image for whatever reason, but we can cross compile it instead.

Changes:
- Updated build image for the target
- Disabled `continue-on-error` option

Build result is tested on my machine, don't see any issues with functionality.

title: Support CICD
body:
## ADMIN NOTE: This flag is now `--ci` (https://github.com/railwayapp/cli/pull/490)

## Support CICD deploys by staying until the build stage is complete and reporting it's result in exit code

### Changes:

- Added new `up` command argument: `cicd`
    When this argument is provided, cli won't stream deploy logs and will exit immediately after deploy status changes to `SUCCESS`.
    This required changing `wait_for_failure` function to support this case. In both of them it will cause the cli to exit with either error exit code or zero, which would indicate success.

title: feat: alpine dockerfile
body:
Dockerfile for #469, not sure if I should do Dockerfile's for other distros or not. 

Also, I haven't made an actions workflow that automatically builds and publishes these yet. I assume that it would be based off of the [cargo-release](https://github.com/railwayapp/cli/blob/master/.github/workflows/cargo-release.yml) file, but I'm not sure.

title: Create Community-Check GH Action
body: adding a new GH Action so all community-made Issues and PRs get sent to the new buzz-oss discord channel

title: support `railway connect` for timescale image
body: So you can `railway connect` with the migrated db

title: Clarify `shell` command
body: Changes the description to make sure it is clear that it is a local subshell

title: Improve login
body: If you answer no to the prompt about opening the browser, instead of just exiting, it'll now perform a browserless login instead.

title: Make `status` show linked service instead of all
body: Instead of showing all services, it now shows just the linked one.

title: support linking to services with no services
body:
Instead of erroring, we simply don't prompt to link a service.

The code for the link command is a bit of a mess with a lot of duplication. Can clean it up at a later date.

title: Add context if terminal is TTY
body: This fixes a [silly bug](https://discord.com/channels/713503345364697088/1164669294966231171/1164705365003341854) where the terminal thinks it is TTY. Unfortunately, we can't do anything about that but we can add extra context to the error.

title: Support `railway connect` for service databases
body:
- Check service instance source and do naive matching to check database type so that we can support the `railway connect` command
- `railway connect {name}` now checks both plugin and service
- Fetch service instances when fetching project

![image](https://github.com/railwayapp/cli/assets/3044853/2721474c-0c54-46d3-8086-d6b2fb704f8b)

title: Lint
body: This PR runs `cargo fmt` and fixes some clippy issues

title: Fix up from automatically selecting a service
body:
Previously, `up` and `logs` would pick a service if only one service was in the linked project. This often caused unwanted behaviour, so this PR changes it to a prompt.

Relevant thread: https://discord.com/channels/713503345364697088/1160376027365785711

title: Add attribute logging
body: This adds support for attribute logging. Screenshots:

title: Allow service to be selected in `railway link`
body:
This adds a new prompt in the `railway link` command allowing you to select a service.

Some notes:
- The links command internal code is a mess (and needs to be cleaned up)
- Logic is often being implemented 3x for the same thing
- This is the same with some other commands, but this is one of the worst

title: Improve clarity in `railway shell` without a service being linked
Remove confusing wording in `railway run`
body: This message that is printed after `railway run` often confuses people.

title: Fix `railway logs` pulling from the wrong deployment
body:
This fixes #436
This also fixes this for linked environments
This also makes sure it pulls from the latest *active* deployment, not just the latest deployment

title: Refactor to shell & inline comments for maintainence
body: From [this](https://discord.com/channels/713503345364697088/1138859969089908816) discord thread

title: Print file size if file too large
Add status code to upload error message
feat: add silent flag to shell
body: Add silent flag to shell that removes "entering subshell with railway..." message

title: fix: Update README Homebrew instructions
body: This is a simple update to the Homebrew installation section in this README. Seems like `rlwy` is outdated now.

title: Add deloyment id to logs
body:
Added a `deployment_id` option for logs. If omitted, logs will be pulled from the latest deployment like before.
Closes #398

title: use `DATABASE_URL` for psql
body:
Currently `railway connect Postgres` asks the user for the database password, this issue isn't present with the other database types when using `connect` as they either use a URI or have the password passed in as a flag.

This PR uses the `DATABASE_URL` variable as the only argument to `psql`
Specifying a connection string has been supported since [psql 9.2.0](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/release/9.2.0/#AEN114358:~:text=option%20for%20views-,Allow%20libpq%20connection%20strings%20to%20have%20the%20format%20of%20a%20URI,-Add%20a%20single)

title: fix<shell>: add "railway.exe" to recursive check list for `scoop` ins…
body:
…tallations

Scoop uses a wrapper executable named "railway.exe" to start the actual railway executable.

title: do not unwrap in up command
body: no unwrapping

title: fix(cmd): Describe `railway connect` properly
body:
`railway connect` has the wrong description (likely copypaste error from `railway environment`).

```diff
- (fix/connect-desc ±) cli ツ railway --help
- Interact with Railway via CLI
- 
- Usage: railway [OPTIONS] <COMMAND>
- 
- Commands:
-   add          Add a new plugin to your project
-   completion   Generate completion script
-   connect      Change the active environment
+   connect      Connect to a plugin's shell (psql for Postgres, mongosh for MongoDB, etc.)
-   delete       Delete plugins from a project
```

title: Stream both build and deploy logs for up command
body:
This PR
- Streams both build and deploy logs when running the up command. This means that the logs will automatically show the correct output. I thought about switching the stream over, but was fighting too much with the Rust compiler and accessing the stream from multiple threads. Streaming both build and deploy logs should have low overhead so I don't think it is a problem.
- Stop streaming the logs and exit with error code 1 if the deployment fails
- Move deployment logs subscription fetching into controller functions
- New GQL query to fetch a single deployment

Fixes https://linear.app/railway/issue/PRO-506/railway-up-should-switch-to-tailing-application-logs-on-success

title: Run `cargo update`
body: Simple package update

title: fix<shell>: remove dbg! macro in windows shell detection
body: I left the dbg!() macro in by accident during the last pr. My bad

title: Better CLI errors
body:
This PR
- Uses custom RailwayErrors to cleanup error handling in many places. Eventually, we should be using these custom errors everywhere. For now, we just use them for a few critical paths
- Wrap all GraphQL errors. This allows us to show custom help messages when not authorized. It also cleans up the data fetching
- Abstract fetching of projects to a controller function. This is just the start of the data fetching refactor. Moving forward we should be using a Railway client for all Railway interaction

title: [command] [up] ignore .git and node_modules by default
body: I've written some code that ignores .git and node_modules by default. I've also added a small amount of documentation to the block that handles the actual compression of the gzipped tarball, since it is, in my opinion, quite hard to read.

title: early return in shell if no environment variables present
body: Issue courtesy of @brody192

title: fix<shell>: fixes shell responding to ctrl-c when it shouldn't
body: Issue courtesy of @brody192

title: fix<run>: allows `railway run` to run batch scripts on windows, including pnpm and npm.
body:
Fixes #386
Allows `railway run` to run other batch script windows programs, such as pnpm and npm.

- one match statement that sets the child proc and does all the argument handling
- moved command spawning away from the match statemnt
- handles no argument passed

title: feat: windows specific shell detection
body:
~~Uses [wmic](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/7486717/finding-parent-process-id-on-windows) and `std::process::id` to detect the parent process and therefore the correct shell to drop the user into.~~

Uses winapi syscalls and the `std::process::id` to detect the parent process of the cli. This either detects a shell listed below or defaults to `cmd`. Does nothing on non-windows platforms because of `#[cfg(target_os = "windows")]`

Supported shells:
- cmd
- Powershell 5
- Powershell 7 (pwsh)
- NuShell
- ElvSh

Edits:
- Because of brody, this now implements [this gist](https://gist.github.com/mattn/253013/d47b90159cf8ffa4d92448614b748aa1d235ebe4)

title: update package.json files
body: Also formatted it

title: update the package.json version on `cargo release`
body: When we run `cargo release patch|minor|major`, the version in `package.json` will automatically be updated

title: Write config tmp file in same directory
body: This fixes an issue where renaming a temporary file from system tmp folder to `~/.railway` could fail if, for example, they were on different OS partitions. This change writes the temporary file to `~/railway/config.tmp` instead, to ensure the operation is as safe as possible.

title: exit with the same exit code as process for railway run
body:
Exit the `railway run` process with the same exit code that the command being run exits with. This is important when using `railway run` to run tests and the tests exit with a non-zero exit code.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3044853/227656879-2454198d-cdb3-47f9-ab82-5a820f9d1b6f.png)

title: Connect command
body:
Implement `railway connect` command from v2

Closes LOG-249

title: Fix config writes
body:
Fixes #385

This PR updates how the CLI writes configs. It now write atomically, by first writing to a tmp file, then renaming to the final destination.

title: Update `open` off of yanked version
body: Currently, you have to `cargo install --locked`, and you get a warning about the yanked version. It seems like the only breaking change to v4 is upping the MSRV (still lower than what's declared for this project).

title: Ignore CTRL+C on `railway run`
body:
This was causing issues where both the child and parent processes would exit at the same time, and the child process would be unable to respond to the SIGINT.

This PR ignores SIGINT on the parent process, and allows the child to handle it.

Resolves #384

title: Fix `railway up` in CI environments
body: Resolves #382

title: fix generation of `.tar.gz` archives on windows
body: maybe fixes #348

title: release binary for `i686-pc-windows-gnu`
body:
Fixes #347.

This is the same case as #316.

title: Add --environment flag for railway up
body:
Should fix #331 

I haven't tested it yet, though.

title: Fix a couple of regressions
body:
- `railway up` now walks up to find the linked directory, and then deploys from there
  - This also fixes a bug where absolute paths would fail to deploy
- `railway login` no longer errors when a user with no name logs in

title: fix `run` command environment arg resolution
body: The environment argument was not being resolved, and was assumed to be an ID

title: fix config race condition
body:
- Fixes a race condition that caused the config file to be overwritten
- Fixes `railway run`

title: Render service variables for `railway variables`, `railway shell`, and `railway run`
body: Fixes the variable rendering on these commands, before it was very hacky and didn't fully render the vars.
